name: Freestyle 2: Street Basketball
description: Freestyle 2: Street Basketball is a fast paced online arcade basketball game. Create your own unique player and compete in the online street league! Use variety of b-ball moves and customize your player! Team up with the best street ballers online and rise to the top!
minimum_requirements: OS: Window XP Processor: Pentium 4 2.8 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 7600 GT 512MB DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Window 7 Processor: Pentium 4 3.4 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce 9800 GT 1GB DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 3 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible

reviews.review_text: I started playing this because its free and I actually enjoyed it. I had like 100+ hours on it creating new accounts to earn 150k points. Bought 500 Gkash for the event.  I was able to feel satisfied with how my character looks and plays. But as soon as I reach level 24. No one would play with you. If there is, they will call you NOOB throughout the whole game. Then use a microphone and harass you throughout.   Community sucks! People are jerks~! There are some who would play with you but for the most part everyone is a jerk.   Downfall of this game is how jerks high level people or seasoned people are and it really sets me back.  Goodluck to this game. Its fun till 24 and if you like getting called noob and doesnt bother getting owned by seasoned players or getting kicked from room to room spending 15 minutes just to play 1 game then get called a noob then kicked then this game is for you.
MY ANTIVIRUS LEGIT PICKED UP A BITCOIN MINER WHEN I UPDATED THIS GAME. THIS NEEDS TO BE OFF THE STEAM STORE. WHAT KIND OF ♥♥♥♥ IS THIS?  EVERYONE REPORT THIS GAME

Real basketball fans and players wouldn't be impressed with this game's mechanics or animations because this game doesn't go for a realistic basketball simulation. Instead this game focuses on team play and player customisation and most of customisable things are aquired by playing the game, not by spending real money. Post game rewards and leveling up keeps you playing and grinding through the game. Just remember that if you want the best experience , team up with 2 of your buddies and it will be a lot more fun and enjoyable to play :)   Overall: If your looking for a realistic basketball simulation - don't bother, It's not NBA 2K, but if your looking for a fun, grindy,arcady team game - try it out.

It was all fun and games, up until you guys made it personal.  How dare you mine my computer? You guys are savages. Theres no remorse, just in it for the profit. In every aspect.  I will never play this game again, how yal betrayed my love for online basketball games.  Just Buy ♥♥♥♥ing 2k. 2k17 is coming out. Also need a controller. But its worth it. At least 2k tells us theyre gonna hustle us.

IGN: Valioa ( Level 50 PG Clara Balanced Type, Known for magical diving catches)  ( ' w ' ) / Ladies and Gentleman. \ ( ' w ' )   This is a game in which you start out as a trainee, learning the ropes of the game, most likely losing a lot (well, it depends if you are playing with total strangers), and as you 'go on', you just get better and better, eventually winning.  Like I said above, don't expect to be good at the start, and PLAY with friends! This game is heavily team-based, featuring 3v3 basketball matches that can get hectic pretty fast in the long run, especially in the pro channels.  When I started out in the game, I didn't like how bad I was, and how bad my teammates were sometimes. But its ok. I came out on top, became one of the best at my position (Point Guard), and I believe I am well known in the FS2 community xD.   ITS ALL ABOUT PERSERVERANCE...!  NEVER GIVE UP! Create the best freestyle 2 team out there with your friends young padawan. Heck, maybe even join a crew (The 'Bruh' Crew, lead by Left-Eye is a really good start, a crew that allows anyone willing to learn the game a chance at getting better overall)  AND REMEMBER.... In Pie We Trust.™ ( ' w ' ) //

I'm gonna say I don't recommend this game for now since they fail to deal with the Hacking basically says its ok to hack away to win. Better off playing NBA2k14 or 2k15. As a gamer its hard for me to talk bad about any games and it pains me to see a game thats fun to be overran by hackers.

Don't waste your time on getting this game.This game is pay to win game.Everytime developers try to fix a bug 2 new ones appear.Bugs are expected but how do you have bug that crashes the sever everytime.If you want to waste your money don't waste here it's not worth it.Lvl 60's of this game are pay to win players that give their money to this game, they make this game hell when trying to lvl up.The only time your going to win is when you are 1-30 lvl.This game is waste of time because once you reach the lvl 50 milestone you never see the light and day until you open your pockets for the game.Why should waste your time on this game that breaks because of giltches and pay to win players.Don't get me started with the chat in this game, the people in this game will tell you how bad you are every single day of life until you make the right decision and unistall this game.If you want to go through hell play this game you'll experince it.

I played many hours of Freestyle back in 2007. This iteration is plagued by slow loading times, a bad user interface, and way too many equippables that distract from the actual game. This game has taken microtransactions to a level I didn't know was possible, and it's all in your face constantly. This feels more like a Korean trinket shop than a video game

Well first 20 minutes of gameplay and i want to delete it allready..If you are a new player no one want to even play with you and beacause the players are so salty with new players.. no one is playng in rookie rooms..Just dont play this game unless you like when other people is swearing you because you are a new player and get kicked every game.. 10/10

Its a good game, however its a f*cking P2W. It always has been ever since it was created with Sierra, I been playing FS for a very long time. However, I will not be putting this as a negative review since I still play this game and will always play it. I just love FS. Don't my cons scare you, however take it in consideration since it's true. If you don't believe me play FS 2 for about 25 hours and then tell me what you see.  Now here is the pro and cons:  Pros: - Fun game when you have respectful players  Cons: - P2W: Pay to Win, which is very true. For example: When you buy a special character, you get a bonus stats when you create them. So if you were a PF, you would get a bonus like 5+ or something like that. - LAGGY, most of the players are from other countries playing on the US server. When you ask them why they don't play on theirs, they say something like 'Nobody is on the server, blah blah' - There are some good clothes in the game, however if you want to add attributes to them you can but they only last like 30 days or so. It wasn't like in FS, where some clothes you could pay to add attributs and it stays with you forever. - The freestyles are random and you never get to choose which ones you want like in FS. For example, if I wanted miller time for my SG, I would have to get Freestlye tickets and play the random sh*t hoping I could get it. - Most people don't know how to play at all, and also there is a lot of holders when it's the last 20 seconds. - The last thing, its a god damn PAY TO WIN.   So, if you want to win a lot, you either do two things: First, pay money to get special characters, etc. Blah blah. Two: practice a lot and learn to PASS the ball, and use teamwork. I prefer the second option since in this game, it is easy to beat the special characters. And it's called TEAMWORK!!!

The game is fun, don't get me wrong, but there is so much P2W aspects of the game it's unreal. It's great for a F2P game, but they could make money the right way and not allow people to P 2 W! There needs to be more modes; maybe a 5v5 full court action. Make the game more realistic and add some more physics and allow me to be able to block a dunk. There is also way too much to the game yet way too little, and what I mean by that, is there are stat cards and free styles and 'magic' clothes that would give you the edge in a match. Just have normal basketball, that's all you need. Too little, basically what I said before, to where there aren't any game modes, and just there isn't much customization either, unless you wanna be a dragon helmeted nba player or a humongous black Jonas Brother. It's fun, but there's issues I'd hope and many others would hope they fix.

I played the very first Freestyle Basketball and then i downloaded the asian version of Freestyle 2 back when it wasn't available for the United States, and I had played it very often when it was available. The one hour I have on steam was to see if this game was still pay to win, sadly it is. When you make a character you get to choose your position and you get to choose between a few sample characters with different heights, if you PAY the game though you can unlock other characters that have boosted stats and are much bigger than you. They will always be better than you no matter how much you play, this game is slightly skill based but it is very much like an arcade game. Rebounds can be grabbed from the other side of the goal just because a player has a higher attribute than you, regardless of your timing and positioning for it. Most shots fall in this game if you dont block them, which if you pay, you block everything. This game has the potential to be so much better, especially because it is the only basketball MMO out there, but they are stupid.
The Game Is Super Awesome.I Think Is The Best BasketBall Game Ever. but please cheaper the premium characters

This game sorta stinks. I can't find a grasp on how the shooting gauge works. The MC is God awfully annoying, since all he says is 'nice pass!' 'oh you sneaky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥!'. Community is filled with stuck up tight-wads with too much bullplop in their ears. Megaphones (an all out broadcast to the server) usually says something from xXx__BALLisLIFE__xXx 'heh rekt u #@$# pretty easily step up your game'. I find these rather disparaging comments annoying.  The rookie channel is, as a commenter said before, filled with pros, as people could not merge their old accounts onto Steam. Articles of clothing are merely for looks, which really shows if someone has easy access to their parents' credit card number. Rookie channel, again, has some people failing a layup or easily shooting half-court threes with no trouble. The game lags a bit, sometimes characters and the ball spazzing out, or having characters that are nowhere near the ball all of a sudden having it.  The community, as said, is a bunch of stuck up tight-wads. Some people ball hog and just keep dunking. Others can't read English, as when you need to go for 3's, they keep making layups. Like what the crud bro.  The swearing filter has a really low bar. Words like 'crap', 'crud', 'wtf', and even IDK has DK censored into i**, assuming dk is short for '♥♥♥♥'. That really throws me off about this game.  To summarize, a stuck up community, poorly optimized gameplay, really harsh swearing filter, spazzy characters and items. Also, don't forget really crappy random drops. Keep pulling blank cards. Continuing: megaphone abuse, and the somehow hated cell-shaded art. I really adore cell shading, so this game is looks nice. Then again, I haven't optimized it for my computer yet. Yet.  Overall, game gets like a 2.5 out of 5 stars. Give it a whirl. If it's not your thing, then uninstall it. That's what I'll be doing.

When I saw this, I was hoping for a competent street basketball game with some paid character customizations and some kinda gross paid stat boosts. What I found instead was a poorly translated storefront with a terrible basketball game attached.  Best I can tell, you are forced to control your character with the keyboard rather than a gamepad, which seems an odd choice for a basketball game. The rules of the game (both in terms of the rules in the rulebook and the way basketball works) are implemented very simplisticly. For example, if you want to block a shot, You'll need to be sure you're in front of the shooting player. It's literally impossible to block a short from the side or from behind.   It feels like a board game implementation of basketball, and, as much as I like board games, the beauty of video games is that the game can juggle as many rules and variables as you can throw at it. Board games have to be simplified because people have to manage all those rules themselves. For a game as dynamic as basketball, this implementation doesn't create a very satisfying experience.  The UI is ridiculous. Every screen has dozens of buttons labeled mostly with cryptic icons. As a new player, you'll be given several reward items after logging in, but you'll have no idea what they are or why you would want them. In this way, the game is extremely hostile to new players.  If there is any fun to be had in this game, it's well hidden behind a smokescreen of odd design decisions and mechanisms designed to get you to give them money.

FreeStyle2: Street Basketball is one of the best sports mmo, and one thing it achieved by being a free mmo is balance. This game is no where close to pay to win, Sure you can buy exp coupons, but a higher level means nothing and the skills you earn are nothing if you're not good enough to use them. I've seen lvl 2 rookies block lvl 40 pros. I recommend this to whoever loves ballin and fairness.

Absolutely NOT Pay2Win if you want to have fun and win. The only 'necessary' spending total around USD20 on 4 extra skill slots in order to maximize gameplay potential. It is only effective when you are commited to go PRO (~lvl 40+), you don't have to spend a dime to be good at this game.  Each game lasts <10 minutes (Forfeit option is available).The community should welcome players from all skill levels. Expect trash talking at higher level games (common phenomenon). Freestyle should grow for the better since Steam launch, unless the developer side don't accomodate for the expansion.   I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys basketball or sports in general. Great fun!

Freestyle 2 caters to both casual and hardcore audiences.  The game's simple learning curve allows anyone to just jump in and start having fun.  As for your main character, you get to choose from 5 positions (Point Guard, Shooting Guard, Small Forward, Power Forward, and Center). There are also 2 Competitive Modes: Team Match which is a 3v3, and Individual Mode is 1v1.  Co-op vs AI mode is also available. If you’re a fan of basketball, there’s no reason you shouldn’t be playing this game.  It’s generous, it gives you free stuff such as clothes and outfits on an almost daily basis, premium characters for free and an amazingly addictive gameplay experience to top it all off.
This is the best game I have ever played.

I'm just going to go straight into it. I've put in about 30 or so hours into this game and I have enjoyed my time spent with it for the most part.  Freestyle 2 is a basketball game that is published by Joycity and hosted by Gamekiss. The game is run on a free 2 play model and while that may raise red flags for some, I've found it to be very fun and fair. After logging in, you are able to pick from a couple of classes. Small Forward, Point Forward, Center, Shot Guard, etc. After choosing a class, you are shown a list of different characters, that are really just chosen based on your preferred look or style. The game doesn't really offer any body customization like skin color, hair, eyes. But you can purchase different clothes, wigs, etc in the game shop. (They actually have a decent selection for the ingame free points that can be earned through playing.)  ~Gameplay~ I've found the mechanics of this game to be enjoyable, they all work how I'd expect. The controls definately took some getting used to. It's been a long time since I've used my keyboads directional keys.   The A button is to drive dribble, which consumes stamina and allows you to dash with the ball to pass your opponent.  S is to pass or steal  D is to shoot or block  W is to guard or post up. (Moving towards the basket with ball in a slower and more defensive motion.  I've found that it's a little bit harder to play defense than offense, but it all works well and feels really good when you dunk on an oppenent and he/she is slammed back down.   Your character(s) also have stats and level up. Level 50 is the max and the progression can be a bit slow after level 30. You put points into various attributes like 3 pt, layup, middle shot, speed, stamina, etc. The stats feel somewhat minor and it take's a bit to really notice a big difference. You can also buy skills and this opens up the game to a lot more, making it faster and way more interesting. One of the skills I received allows me to drive dribble back and forth to really shake up my opponents.   I find the gameplay extremely enjoyable and for that alone, I can reccommend this game to just about anyone especcially if you have friends, but we will get to that.  ~Graphics~ The game looks nice. It's a very simple cel shaded style and it runs pretty well on most low end computers that I've played on as well. If you turn up the game to high/medium, you may notice the game having a blurry effect on the characters. I personally didn't like this effect and found the game to look better on low. You only have preset graphic selections of low, medium, and high, so I found no way to turn it off. Speaking of which, I should probably talk about the options menu a bit more.  You cannot rebind your keys for drive dribble, pass, shoot, steal, or your movement. I found that to be a bit silly in a pc only game. Also no controller support, but they offer a guide on the site's forums that is stickied and it explains how to use a controller. This is still not a good thing in my opinion and hopefully they will add more options in the future, but I don't see it happening.   ~Sound~ The music is different to say the least. It's like k pop mixed with rap. I personally liked it and at times found it hilarious, but after a while I got tired of hearing the same tracks over and over again and listened to some of my own music.   ~Community~  Disclaimer: Another persons experience may differ from mine.  So the community is pretty small, but you should not have an issue finding any games. Though, I must reccommend playing with friends. Usually in a small community, you would expect players to be a bit more tight-knit, but that is far from the case. There are a lot of people that say the trash talking is just apart of the game. I can agree some what with that, but that isn't where my problem with the community really comes from.  You will experience more ♥♥♥♥ talking from fellow team mates. Players will berate you if you just get unlucky and miss a shot. You may see people go into all chat and call there own teammates noobs, because they are losing the game. (You lose nothing important by losing a game except your winrate and you still recieve the same exp and points for losing or winning.)   Edit: I can understand someone not wanting to see their win ratio lowered. I've done quite a bit of competitive gaming and sometimes communities will judge based on your win ratio and not your actual skill. It's just the way of the world, unfortunately.  I have to reccomend that you play this game with friends, because it is an extremely good time with people you know, win or lose.   ~Cash shop pay to win or not?~ I've played up to level 50 so far and have not experienced any real need to pay. Though there are things to pay for if you want to min max. There are cards that can be found with either luck or in a gachapon that boost your stats by a couple of points and then can be upgraded further. Some may want to find the best versions of those cards that upgrade the stats they want. There are also some cash only cosmetics to purchase, but no outfits have an expiration date and as I've said earlier, I was able to find a decent selection for points and they didn't take very long to buy.   You can pay for extra skill slots and that seems to be the most pay 2 win aspect, but from what I've read, you can make a good character without ever paying.  There are also exp boosts and such for conveniece and I've found the model to be fair and I don't think there is anything wrong with the system.  ~Conclusion~  I can definitely reccommend this game to just about anyone, especially if you have friends to play with. You will have an easier time with the community if you solo que at a lower level, but once you get into the higher leveled games, you will see a lot of hostility from your own teammates. Other wise, this is probably one of the best basketball games I've ever played. It runs well and does everything I'd expect from it.

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.  Ingredients: 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter 2. 1/2 cup white sugar 3. 1/2 cup brown sugar 4. 1/4 cup water 5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 6. 1 pinch salt 7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced 8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie   Directions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside. 3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices. 4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal. 5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust. 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

262hours and counting.  These are the Pros and Cons that I have personally experienced in the game, you may or may not agree with me but i'm just trying to share a fun game to people who either want a casual or a competitive game to play.  Pros - Got a lot of cool events and giveaways - Part team-based, part individual skill-based gameplay. (You can win if you are good in at least 1 of the two) - Titles and Achievements that rewards players with goodies. (Item ball, Magic Ball, etc.) - The Character Customization is quite fun. - I personally like the graphics and it has a low system requirement which is a plus for me because of my beloved ancient laptop. - Meet a lot of fun people to play with.  Cons - Encountering Toxic People both in game and in the lobby. (It's understandable to admonish a mistake in gameplay in higher channels like pro and pro2 but mistakes done in both rookie and major channels should be understandable to people.) - A difference in ping is huge when it comes to Big Men positions (C and PF), because the rebounding is crucial to the game.  - Special Characters have noticeable advantages to normal created characters. (But I have 3 spc. characters without spending a dime because of amazing events.) - Not really that much of a Pay-to-Win Game, even though in higher channels Pro-Pro2, much needed stats gained from special cards and equipment would come as a great help. - If you are a VIP member, you can kick the host of the game that you are playing. (Seriously!? If you don't like the host then just leave then create your own room.)  I may have forgotten to write a few Pros and Cons but you get the point. Seriously, just earnestly try to have fun in playing any game than interests you and the game would be fun to play.

I wish Steam had the option to give a 'mixed' review, because I honestly can't say my review is either positive or negative. Out of coherence, since for past games I had the same problem with I just put in 'positive', we'll go with that. I do enjoy the game.  It's pretty simple, it's super fun, and the style not only of the characters, but of pretty much all of the items and interface are mostly consistent and hella stylish. Seriously, every minor artwork for events has their suburban/slightly anime schtick. Soundtrack helps a lot with the feel too, although obviously it gets repetitive after a while.  Unfortunately, the game is plagued by some issues that cannot be ignored: first of all, having a bad ping absolutely destroys your game experience and that of the others. It's not as bad as in other games, but that's not saying much: it's pretty terrible.  Secondly, the game is very luck-based, which arguably some casual players might enjoy, but not me. Admittedly, it makes sense in the way they made it, having your chance of success or fail an action depend on your stats compared to those of your adversary, trying to simulate variation or something... still, this effectively means playing consistently doesn't yield the same result all the time, and sure, the usual argument against this is 'that just means you have to adapt to new circumstances', but I personally dislike this approach. Plus, someone succeeding a low-chance Steal, turning around shooting 2pt is not exactly giving anyone time or chance to react, although obviously there are plays and 'strats' that, paired with reflexes, minimize risks. So, it's bad, but not all that bad.  Secondly, the oh-so-dreaded pay2win. It's definitely there. There's this argument going around, claiming that 'even if you pay for the boosts, you gotta know how to use your character, so this isn't true', but what the people who say this are forgetting is that that effectively means if two people of roughly the same 'skill level' meet, the person who payed will objectively have better stats and therefore the exact advantage they need to defeat the other person, without having achieved this via either luck or skill.  Overall, try it. It's fun. I'm not taking it seriously and I'm having a blast, but I'm not sure I'd ever want to touch the comp scene.

Although I love this game, it has a lot of flaws. I love playing this with friends, and it has lots of replay value, but with these fun points, some features ruin the gameplay.  Pros: -Great Replay Value -Fun with friends -Cartoony graphics that set the mood -Lots of features -Good multiplayer and good features -Its free!  Cons: -Pay to win -Buggy menus and often crashes (from my perspective) -Overpriced micro transactions -Crappy Music   Overall, I really enjoy this game, but I think the developers went a bit overboard on the pay to win features. I like buying new clothes and different accesories, but the fact that you can buy characters with a gameplay advantage, and buy your player into the best is a bit stupid. I still enjoy this game a lot either way.

Reminds me of my younger days. Unfiltered basketball.  EDIT::  There WAS multiple channels for this game to kep skill based matchmaking fair.  Rookie 1 Channel / 1-11 Completely for newcomers)  Rookie 2 Channel / 1-11 (For high level experienced players starting a new character or very good rookie 1 players who pick up the game fast. You are forced to play in rookie 2 if you fit the criteria.)  Major Channel / 12-24  (Where rookie 2 and rookie 1 players merge. It's overall balanced here because rookie 1 players should get the gist of the game by now.)  Pro Channel 1 / Level 24-39 Nothing much to say here.  Pro Channel 2 / 24-50 Pro 1 players can come here but I highly don't recommend it.  -----------------  As you near the max level you will realize that the game is ultimately Pay 2 Win, or at the very least pay to have a ridiculous advantage.  Example: Buying a level 1 SPC (Special Character) is about $15 while the same SPC character at level 40 is up to $50. With this SPC you get 40 extra stat points. Now to explain stat points - there are attributes such as 3pt shots, rebounding, passing, short lay-ups, long lay-ups, stealing, and more.   The higher the stat the better the succes rate. You get 2 points each time you level up. Then you go to level your attributes. Each attribute to level up has 4 segments of 5 bars to fill. At first it cost 1 point to level up. So 5 points to level up the first 5 bars which is the first segment. Then is cost 3 points to level up in segment two. So a total of 15 points to level the next 5 bars to get to segment three. Segment three; which is 5 points to level up one bar totaling 25 points to fill up segment 3.  (I think segment four is 7 per bar, going by a pattern)   Now let me repeat. SPC's get 40 extra stat points to spend on the attributes. Starting at level 1.  ----------  Now granted it is pretty fun and you dont really notice the pay-to-win players until you get to the Pro channel's. But now it's worse. A recent update -which is why I'm making this new review- has merged The two rookie channels into one rookie channel, and same for the pro channels. Think for a moment on what you just read and you'll see how unbalanced that gets very quickly. New players facing SPC users, and new pro players that don't pay to win at level 24 being matched up with full-on level 50 SPC users with those 40 extra stat points. Good luck. The wall the gave this game and players some idea of what little fairness was there to begin with has now gotten completely demolished.   ----------   Do I thumbs the game up? Yes. Why? Because it can still be fun, and you have a choice to play with computers, for an extreme amount of lowered XP per match. Do I think people should play it? With this recent update? No. I say Gamekiss should make two servers. One for people who are free-to-play and one for the combined community; free to play and not. The matchmaking has gotten too unbalanced. If it was a shooting game bullets can make a person go down easy, so pay to win doesnt mean much. But this is a basketball game. Every, dunk, block, and turnover means all that much more with higher stats over the course of a long 5 minutes per game. The community is also very toxic, often times for no good reason.

Pro: +Funny gameplay. Very funny! +Coop. +Lots of customization. +Lots of free characters to choose+++! +Cell shading. +Ceremonies when scoring. Con: -Community. Very Toxic. -UI Slow. Slow loading screen. Poor optimization. -Music is ok but needs more variety. -P2W. This is a very competitive game. Skill beats money. But luck is based on attributes. More attributes means more chance to score 2p, 3p, Steal, etc. -You need very good ping for competitive and not many servers. People who live inside the server will benefit a lot. -Very bad matchmaking. (level 1-11 <this is the very nice, 12-23 <you will be kicked a lot but very balanced matches and most fun, 24-50 <very unbalanced matches). -Sometimes is hard to find people to play with. -Grinding level is hard. -Expensive items. e.g. 16€ for 4 skill slots for one of your characters.  I can't recommend this game right now because matchmaking and P2W system. Don't lose your time, fool!

This game isnt pay to win. I didnt spend a penny and I average 60-70% winrate on all of the characters which is insane. I've played this game ever since it first came out in Korea (good ole FS1 days) and I can tell you for sure it's all about TEAMWORK. This game isn't enjoyable if you are playing by yourself because you will meet players who just don't get the game. So a rule of thumb is if you like whoever you played with, just add him/her so you can play together next time.   Few additional helpful tips are (in-game): 1. Always look to pass  2. Don't go for block everytime the opponent does a pumpfake  3. Know your strength and abuse it   Hope you guys enjoy this game too! It's free afterall

The gameplay is solid, though it'd be cool to have the option to play full court with bigger teams. The menus and everything other than actual gameplay is a cluster♥♥♥♥ hoarder mess. There's so much going on you find yourself lost in a maze of receive gift/receive item buttons and also there's some sort of board game with a cow you move around to get more ♥♥♥♥. Where am I and who is sending these gifts? Mysteries that will never be solved.  ultimately the game feels like what it is, a manufactured bloated mess. It's fun in the same way that a snes basketball game is, which means it's ok. But it'll never be anything more than 'ok'. Changed review to not recommended because I can't see a reason to play this over literally any other game.

I find the load times to be somewhat lengthy. I'm sure if you could get that sorted, along with the server connection times - then I may be able to get into it, but atm, as it currently is - It's just not for me. Good luck to the producer, and I wish only good game to all who enjoy this, but again - It's just not for me. I'll stick to my NBA 2k. I also enjoy a really great b-ball game on the Wii (original) using Wiimote n Nunchuck. To be honest though, I (personally) have never enjoysed sports games on PC. I don't know why, but I just don't. GG to ALL - GG!!!

The game is amazing, the community not always. I wish muting was easier.   This game is like a mmorpg of basketball where you get matched with players in your skill range. You level up skills and use skills on opponets and do more damage (score or defend). The feel of the game is smooth and the makers are extremly reliable. It is a pay to win. But it is a very fun game, forking over money is worth it i feel like with this game, this company put out a solid game and they ban people for toxicity all the time. One of my favorite things with this company is that they release the names of the people they banned for the month (with *'s to hide actual names) so people who played with them saw they had been punished.  If you play this game, play for fun like the majority of us. Don't take this game seriously, and if you do don't rage at your teamates for trying to have a good time.
I like the customization, the skills, the freestyle, the art.          Hate the community.
